Reviews.Title: “Good location, simple hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Marina v Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is very good, it's easy to find and its only a few minutes walk from the Dam square and the tram station, from where its very easy to get anywhere in Amsterdam. The gentleman who welcomed me was friendly enough. The room was simple, but clean and everything I needed was there. The shower and toilet where right on the hallway, and they were also very clean. I have been staying in nicer rooms before for the same amount of money, but this is Amsterdam after all.

Reviews.Title: “two days at the Aspen”
Reviews.Author: james h Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was very small but clean. Hotel located in the center and an easy walk from the main station. The owner/manager was a friendly guy that answered all my questions. There are 8 rooms in this hotel 4 on each floor. There was never a problem with bathroom/shower access.The stairs are narrow and steep and one should not be drunk or otherwise compromised mentally when ascending and descending the stairs. I basically enjoyed my stay and for the price would return. Very good for Amsterdam prices.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, clean but budget”
Reviews.Author: LilSco24
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aspen is in a great location in central Amsterdam. The hotel was clean and tidy, but you definitely get what you pay more. Nothing more than a budget hotel but certainly a step up from a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Spartan, but in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Satchel2010
Reviews.Content: You will ascend up a charming yet steep winding staircase to check in at the second floor, and your rooms will be another floor up. The innkeepers are very nice and the hotel is in a good location - walking distance from the train station and close enough to the Anne Frank House. For people from the US, don't expect the usual amenities like shampoo, fans, TV, or ice buckets, and you'll be fine. This is a terrific place to stay if you just need a clean safe place to sleep in a good location. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality budget”
Reviews.Author: LondonPaul
Reviews.Content: I love budget hotels in Amsterdam, and have tried plenty, so I very reluctant to critisise one, but this place disappointed me. It was clean and warm, and convenient for the area I needed ( Dam Square) but I am pretty sure I could find much better for the price or a little extra. No breakfast, the smallest shared shower I have ever seen (you literally have about 5 inches of wriggle room before your clothes and towel get wet and you get scalded or frozen in the spray) and it is entirely characterless. This is a budget hotel that doesn't even try. The reception is held in someones bedroom/living room, which isn't a great first impression.No TV, no kettle and curtains that let the light in from the main drag if my room is anything to go by, with some rumbling trams. You get a complimentary soap that smells like carbolic and a plastic cup for your toothbrush. I agree, it can be seen as a great budget hotel, and it is not awful, but my advice is to shop around, and be willing to pay a little extra for the extras than can make budget hotels in the city really good, like 24 hour reception, great breakfasts and friendly, funky staff. See my previous reviews for details. Oh, and enjoy Amsterdam, it's amazing! As anyone who chooses budget in Amsterdam will know, be prepared for the steepest, cruelest stairs imaginable...it's pretty much unavoidable!

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever”
Reviews.Author: Alvinerius
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed in such a horrable place in my entire life. I was alone and it was very hard to fit myself and my suitcase in the same room. The are many spots in the room carpet and I didn't see such a clean hotel as I expected after reading these comments. The shared bathroom is ridiculous, There's only space for the bath, where you have to dress and undress yourself. If you go to the shower wearing jeans, be sure it will get wet when you dress it back. I also had to check out at 10 o'clock sharp, because there were other guests coming and the owner was extremely rude ordering me to leave the hotel. It was a terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johnas77
Reviews.Content: Firstly, to all those reviews moaning that this is a no frills hotel - what do you expect for the money you're paying? This hotel is advertised EVERYWHERE as a budget, basic hotel and it delivers exactly what it promises. I have stayed here twice now with a group of friends - both times for the Amsterdam Marathon. The hotel is brilliantly located with a supermarket a block away and 5 minute walk from Dam Sq. It's true - the stairs are not suitable for elderly or frail travellers or if you travel with substantial luggage. However, this is clearly mentioned on all blogs and hotel reviews. The owner/landlord is great - always friendly and smiling and welcomes you to his home and city. This is a family run business and it does feel like it. I will be back as Hotel Aspen is real value for money in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “1 star hotel with no frills”
Reviews.Author: AmitZ
Reviews.Content: This 1 star hotel is conveniently located very near DAM square, the canals, Anne Frank house, tram stations and an Albert Heijn supermarket. Hoped when booking the hotel that it was more the just the basics... but I was wrong. Advantages: Got room an hour early since it was already ready and we had arrived. No problem leaving luggage after checkout until leaving the city at the hotel. Free wifi Clean. Smoke free - at least that's what the owner said , other review here state otherwise. Location is great. Disadvantages: Entrance to the hotel is a very very steep staircase, getting to rooms on top floor is 71 stairs. Read about this before but I didn't believe it would be so crazy but - it is the steepest staircase I have seen in my life and getting a suitcase up the stairs to the top floor is a total body workout. 1 light bulb for the whole room - not very helpful - had to keep bathroom door open so light would come in. there was a tiny reading light above a sort of shelf. Double beds are small and seperated (twin) so don't plan on rolling to your partners bed in the middle of the night ...... No desk or anything of the sort. NO air\con or safe. No breakfast option. The men at the front counter are nice (Esam and an older man were there at the time) and helpful with travel tips around the city. With all the positive reviews I though maybe it would still hold a certain standard but would recommend this hotel for people on a very tight\nonexistent budget or students or someone who simply has no other choice . The place is at a level with low rated hostels. It isn't terrible, it just isn't somewhere I would like to be on vacation. Throw in a couple of more Euros and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, very inexpensive, good location”
Reviews.Author: jrissman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Aspen with friends in June 2011. We chose it because it is not too far from the city center and it was very inexpensive. Upsides: The room was clean and reasonably large. The staff was friendly. Very inexpensive. Central location, but not too close to the red light district. Downsides: The room strongly smelled of marijuana smoke when we got it. We left the window open on our first day, and the smell was mostly gone after that. Also, the staircases are very steep, and we had to carry our bags up three flights of stairs. Be careful when climbing the last flight! I hit my head quite hard on the ceiling above the staircase at one point.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: angelat33
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here. Centrally located we were able to easily walk everywhere, Anne Frank house, red light district and train station. Great helpful hosts. Smaller room with large window was very clean. Shared shower was tiny but it did the job. Great value. A lot of great restaurant and coffee shops nearby. Free fast Wifi. Stairs were somewhat frightening :). Great place we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Basic and clean...watch out when it is warm!”
Reviews.Author: Getthatrunin
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was what I had expected after reading about It on many review sites. The rooms were small and very basic with mushy tiny beds but everything was clean and our host was very friendly and informative. One thing I must say is that the owners should invest in fans!! Our room was SO stifling hot at night and it was not even a hot day. Opening the window only slightly helped. Please, Hotel Aspen...have a few room fans on hand just in case!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean room, & friendly host!!”
Reviews.Author: NatashaOH
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed four nights in this conveniently located Amsterdam hotel. It's just minutes from the Anne Frank museum, Dam square, lovely canals, great shopping, and good food. Although the steps are steep it was still worth the stay here. If you're on a budget and looking for some place to just sleep and relax after a day of seeing sights then this place is perfect! It's very clean and the gracious host, Esam, will greet you with a warm smile and his knowledge of all the sights and neighborhoods to visit. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with nice location”
Reviews.Author: ErnestKusuma
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nearby the canals. Abt 15min walk from the red light district. It's on the 2nd floor, with a steep staircase.. A nice old gentleman will greet you and give you info about anything in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well located, good budget hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: pepipox
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, no-frills hotel located right in the middle of Amsterdam. The hotel is very clean and very well maintained. The room was very clean and in very good condition. The owner was very helpful and kind. This hotel is really well located just in the center of Amsterdam, two blocks away from The Dam and just around the corner of Anna Frank's house. I really recommend it, for a very nice budget hotel in a good location. The only but, is be careful since it has a very steep staircase with no lift, which could be problematic for some.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean budget hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SaltaireClaire
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a budget weekend away. The stairs are extremely steep but if you don't have much luggage and are fairly mobile, they should be manageable. We stayed in a great triple room, which was quite spacious, spartan but clean and quiet. Perfect for what we wanted, also location is 15 mins walk from central station and very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Jodi_Shaun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Aspen for two nights. We stayed in room 5 which is a double room on the top floor. The room was very small but perfect considering we were only there for sleeping. The toilet and shower are in the hallway. The room was clean, it had a basin and also free Wifi. There are a lot of stairs to climb, and yes they are steep, but it is a traditional Amsterdam building and there is no other way of getting to the top. The location was fantastic. It is right in the heart of the city so walking distance to everything or there is a tram stop nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Satans7thBride
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here! The location was perfect, just a short walk from Dam Square and right next to a delicious pancake house. Also our room had an amazing view! The staff/owner of the hotel was extremely helpful and friendly too. The room itself was comfortable, it just had two single beds and a desk and some chairs, and the bathroom was actually a pretty decent size. No complaints. The ONLY downside was the very steep and never-ending stairs! Apart from that it was great though. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with a murderous staircase”
Reviews.Author: ampett
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Aspen. The folks at reception were always very nice, and seemed to be available at all hours of the day. We had a top floor room, and it was wonderful to wake up and watch the bicycle traffic. The windows don't block sound at night however, and it would have been hard to fall asleep if I weren't exhausted from sightseeing. The room was clean and well-maintained, and the beds were relatively soft. The staircase was a doozy. It's almost a vertical climb, and by the time I reached the third floor I was always ready to drop. That said, the staff were always offering to help with bags. The proprietor was also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for people who will only use it for sleep!”
Reviews.Author: kallirache
Reviews.Content: My husband and me went to Amsterdam this April for a short break ,no thanks to the volcano. Well we booked this place because we saw how close it was everywhere and compared to other en-suit rooms it wasnt too expensive. It is located 3 mins away from Dam Square and had a tram stop almost outside the door :) it was 20 meters away from the West Kerk and everything was walking distance. The ONLY minus of the hotel are the stairs, and to be fair a lot of hotels are made that way, but they were very steep! if you have a lot of luggage it will be a mission, but the owner is really helpful and he asked if we had any other bags he could help us with ( i think he was surprised a woman can travel with only one bag!). our room was on the top floor, obviously, but it was worth it coz we had an awsome view and it wasnt so loud since the hotel is on the main road. The room was minimal but clean! crisp white sheets, fluffy pillows and extra blankets in the wardrobe. the bathroom had a shower and there were fresh towels daily and it was extremely cozy. We werent there to stay in the room and we found it to be exactly what we where looking for. I mean for the money we paid for we thought we would get worse but it was fine! and we got experience with hotels in amsterdam since we had to stay in 3 other ones when our flights were cancelled. they were more expensive and the only difference would be that there was a tv and a bathtub instead of a shower. The Aspen hotel is good for students and people who need the room to just sleep, sometimes :) oh and free WIFI !!!!

Reviews.Title: “40th Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: CBRSPDR
Reviews.Content: We had a BLAST! We loved our room at the Hotel Aspen!! We actually extended our stay by a day and enjoyed every extra minute we had in Amsterdam. We found the location to be very handy for walking and for public transportation. We also found the staff and ownership of the hotel to be AWESOME!!!!! We will be back:)

Reviews.Title: “Beware The Stairs”
Reviews.Author: Misshel1
Reviews.Content: Having just arrived back home from our stay at the hotel i felt i had to write a review. I was very nervous about staying here after reading some reviews left, however it wasnt too bad. The stairs are a killer after walking round all day, the rooms are very basic no tv no radio just two single beds and bathroom. The rooms were very clean and beds very comfy. The location of the hotel was great right nr Dam square and about 10-20 mins away from Liedersplein and Rembrandtsplein. It was also nr to Centraal Station but be advised if you're walking from the train station look at a map beforehand otherwise u'll be searchin forever.

Reviews.Title: “Owner very helpful”
Reviews.Author: getupandgonow
Reviews.Content: I made reservations the night before by phone - owner very helpful. Arrived and he continued to offer assistance as needed. This area of Aspen is beautiful and so much to do. Whether you stay here on not would depend on the level of luxury you expect. It offers basic accommodations. They do take pets. A plus.

Reviews.Title: “location good, hotel bad”
Reviews.Author: kennesaw
Reviews.Content: spartan and cramped. purely third or fourth rate place to stay. Manager Esam is nice, his wife is rude and mean. I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “the steepest staircase in the world”
Reviews.Author: egiep
Reviews.Content: booked in at the aspen and was greeted by the highest and steepest staircase i have ever seen in my life if you have a fear of heights do not stay here you might get in you wont get out the owner seemed okay but the rooms are really of low budget quality and the stairs are ridiculous especially if you are on the top floor which means 3 flights of 2 inch wide mountainous stairs to climb

Reviews.Title: “Great no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christian377
Reviews.Content: Pro's: Hotel is a great value in a good location. Most things to do in Amsterdam were a 10 minute walk. 2 blocks from tram. Room was clean and quiet. Esam, the owner was very friendly and helpful. Had room ready for us at 10:00 AM because we arrived on an early flight. Con's: Very steep staircase, no elevator. We had only backpacks, so no problem, but this would have been difficult with suitcases. Lobby is 2 flights up. No TV. We had a quiet room facing a courtyard, but the front rooms face a moderately busy street, so they would be noisier. No breakfast included- most other hotels have breakfast. This is not a luxury hotel, but is a great value. The owner is awesome- he gave us a map and marked all of the things we wanted to do to make navigating easier. One night he stopped us on the way out the door to let us know that a rainstorm was coming, and not to forget our umbrellas- and it poured later that night!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: rrh28
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The owner was super nice. Very sweet guy. He told us where to eat, how to get there- circled all the great things to do on a map for us. We were leaving one night to go out and he stopped us to let us know it would be raining later.... we would of been drenched without our umbrellas! You can tell that he truly cares about his guests. The rooms were clean, simple. We stayed in a room facing the backyard. Very pretty view of trees and homes. He even gave us the option if we wanted a room facing the street or the backyard. The room facing the street had a super cool view, but we wanted quiet at night. He was great to give us the option, though. There are a lot of stairs at this hotel. You walk in the front door and it is stairs up to the second floor where the office is located. There are 3 floors of rooms. If we ever go back- this is where we will stay. I would reccomend this hotel to our family and friends! You can't find a better location: It's 2 blocks from Anne Franks home. Pick this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Essentially a B&B without the Breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: lucie62
Reviews.Content: I knew what to expect from the photos and reviews on here, and they give a very accurate account. The steep stairs weren't a problem really as we only had hand luggage, but I wouldn't want to carry a holiday suitcase up them. After a few beers they do seem to go on forever!!!!! The location is great and you can walk to pretty much anywhere in Amsterdam. The bedroom was basic and quite small with a sink. We shared a toilet and shower with 3 other rooms. The overall feel was one of University halls of residence, which for us was fine to use as a base. I didn't see anyone else in the other rooms other than when they arrived or left so there was no worry about using the facilities as and when you wanted (the hotel was full). Generally a good, cheap base for seeing the sites of Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Good location, basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: debzii
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Aspen Hotel in a room with private bathroom for 3 nights in March 09. There is no lift and there is a very steep long staircase up to the Reception area (more like the manager's living quarters!) and then even more to the rooms, so this may be a problem for some with heavy luggage. The room was clean but very basic, and we got two single beds despite booking a double room. The bathroom was also clean but very small. The staff (we encountered two during our stay) were both very friendly and helpful in recommending and booking tours to the countryside (recommended!). The location was great - 5 min walk to dam square. So if you want a very basic room in a good location and don't need any extras, this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel for small groups.”
Reviews.Author: noodles19
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a three person room with our own bathroom. we booked a month and a half ahead of arrival and paid in cash on arrival. we paid 140euros each for 4 nights stay. the room was on the 3rd floor and in total there was 73 (steep) steps to our room! the room was basic, with 3 single beds, a small closet,a phone, but a nice sized bathroom with a large shower. We were given a key for our room and the hotel front door- so there was no curfew, however the manager did ask us that if we did come in late to try and be as quiet as possible. we found the manager pleasent, friendly and helpful. the location is second to none, 5 mins to dam square,10mins to red lgiht, 10/15 to leidesplainand flowermarket, 5 min tram ride (no.14) to rembrantplein (1.60 euros oneway), and 2 min walk to westerkerk and anne frank house. Clean,comfortable,cheap and fantasic location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Aspen Amsterdam.. Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Pablo_M
Reviews.Content: Before booking one triple room and one twin room for three nights at Hotel Aspen I had read all reviews on TripAdvisor, it appeared to be a decent budget hotel going by what I had read. I booked directly through the Hotel Aspen website and had received confirmation via email. I was travelling in a group of five. We were in Europe on vacation for one month and Amsterdam was our last destination before returning home. Unfortunately what eventuated upon our arrival was straight out of a bad dream. Upon arriving at the hotel the owner advised us that he had recently experienced a computer crash and had lost all booking information. He explained that due to this he was not able to reserve any rooms for us. The owner was quick to shift the blame to me for not calling ahead and confirming the booking, I advsied him that I very rarely call ahead to confirm bookings once I have received an email confirmation that I can present upon arrival. I advised him that I had already provided him with my email address and mobile phone number but he said all this information had been lost in the computer crash and therefore was unable to contact me. However, the owner did make an attempt to accommodate us and offered us a quad room with NO private bathroom facilities and one twin room with private facilities but could only offer this for the first night. On the second night he said that we would need to vacate the quad room and move to a triple room with facilities. We were told that on the third night he could not offer us anything and that we would need to go elsewhere. The owner went as far as showing us the rooms. He took us up a second flight of steps and proceeding to show us the accommodation, surprisingly the rooms were occupied but he had no hesitations in opening the doors and letting us in for a viewing. Guest luggage and personal belongings were still in the rooms, we found this a bit unsettling and decided at that point that we would go elsehwhere altogether and promtly left the premises. Not only were we disappointed with the obvious lack of respect for privacy on the owner's behalf but also the facilities, the shared toilet and shower were two seperate converted closets in the hallway. When we questioned the owener about the apparent lack of cleanliness he said that he cleaned the property himself so everything was clean. We ended up staying at the Hotel Ambassade for three nights, and because it was mid week the Hotel Ambassade offered us a reduced rate so we only ended up paying a fraction more than we would have. Hotel Ambassade was superb! As the saying goes "you get what you pay for" so we should not have been surprised at the short comings of Hotel Aspen. Next time we will certainly think twice before booking at such a low budget Hotel (with no computer backups in case of a hard drive crash).

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: Roberto84
Reviews.Content: good location, really clean.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Afrando
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a twin room with bathroom which was basic but clean. The hotel is very centrally located. It is literally a 2 min walk from Anne Franks house and the palace. The manager was very friendly and provided us with a map and tips on tourist attractions. The only real downsides were: 1. The stairs, as there is no elevator and they are very steep. The manager helped us carry our luggage up and down them though 2. Breakfast was not included which was dissapointing, considering the price we paid for the room. However, there are places close by (I reccommend Saras pancake house) or the supermarket for self catering

Reviews.Title: “Central location with friendly staff, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: BookingNextTrip
Reviews.Content: Converted house (with an enormous staircase) in central Amsterdam. Staff very friendly, gave us a map and explained how to get to attractions. We booked a double room but got a twin (not even a European double) and this was a bit disappointing. Rooms an okay size and bathroom clean (shower akwardly positioned however). No fridge or television but room does have a phone. Whilst a non-smoking hotel, the room smelt of marijuana. We weren't unhappy with the hotel but wouldn't return for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “location!! nice staff”
Reviews.Author: thecompass
Reviews.Content: Japan 1 person I stayed for a week. that is my 3rd times amsterdam. maybe single room is 38 euro. YH is about 30 .

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MasterJudge
Reviews.Content: Good rooms in a central spot. Its rooms are nice and clean. I was in a studio without toilet as well as a full bedded room with toilet and both were great. The small single room is a real good value for a single traveller. The stairs are steep but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Don"t let the stairs fool you”
Reviews.Author: acorn11
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to any frugal traveler. Better, quieter and cleaner than any hostel. And after a long summer day of touring the city and its many attractions I was happy to crash into my very pleasant bed. I stayed in the quad room with three friends, both the room and bathroom were of decent size. We had a huge window overlooking a back garden and had plenty of light and fresh air. I stayed in hostels and hotels around Europe and this was one of the best considering the price and excellent location. You really can't ask for a better location. The manager was very sincere and kind. When pressed for money he tried very much to help our tight situation. Eventually he was able to exchange some forgotten US dollars to euros. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. That is if I could scrap up enough money to return,,, p.s. Sara's pancake house, a few doors down makes a great breakfast/brunch stop.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Manager Ever”
Reviews.Author: tywhitney
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving in Amsterdam, we were very disoriented. We gladly came to find that the hotel that we had booked was not that far away from centraal station and that it was on a very beautiful and popular road in the city. The hotel itself is situated in a beautiful 150 year old building and our room had a great view of Amsterdam out the window. Rudy is the name of the owner/ manager and he is very very friendly. Just a note, the hotel does not have an elevator and the stairs to navigate the place are pretty intense. Once you get past that, the the view, location and price make up for the lack of room amenities and the climb. There is no T.V. or radio, but like I said, the location is worth it along with the fact that Rudy didn't mind us smoking in the room. I recommend staying in room 7 which is a double room and has a shower and a window that is great for people watching and smoking out of. Let me say again that Rudy the owner is awesome. He discounted our room when we decided to stay there for a second go around, and he gave us our favorite room again. All in all this was a great place for a budget travelor to stay and perfect for two young travelers making there way through the bike madness of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “decent stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: jhung403
Reviews.Content: Plenty of stairs to climb but I guess that this is the norm for Amsterdam. The hotel manager is helpful and friendly. The bathroom is a little smelly but clean. The shower room is extremely tight. Our room was also quite cozy. The location is excellent, a quick bike ride away to the Anne Frank House or Dam.

Reviews.Title: “Clean budget hotel; bring a light suitcase!”
Reviews.Author: MJSNyc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aspen is a clean, basic, budget hotel. No frills whatsoever. No TV, no radio. (Phone, yes.) The towels were tiny and scratchy, and the shower basically worked. But overall, the hotel and the room were clean and tidy, and fairly quiet (especially if you use earplugs to block some of the street noise, if your room is in the front of the building facing the street). Rooms at the back of the building seemed much quieter. But beware: the stairs are challenging, so if you stay here, I hope you have a small, light suitcase! One person in our party notoriously overpacks, which she did again this time. Getting her bag up the staircase was difficult, to say the least. The location is pretty convenient. Avoid the pancake house a couple of doors down: terrible food, outrageous prices. For a great meal, go to the absolutely gorgeous public library (across a small bridge from Centraal Station)--which also boasts more than 100 free Internet terminals. The restaurant is on the top floor of the library, and it's AMAZING. Seriously, it's not to be missed. We also liked Bagels and Beans up the street (opens at 9 am) and the little restaurant a couple of doors up on the corner (can't recall the name). By the way, it's easiest to get around town on foot, since most of the attractions are close enough to walk to without difficulty. The tram is OK, but it can be a bit confusing if you are accustomed to a subway-type system.

Reviews.Title: “The value for money choice in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: SoapsLondon
Reviews.Content: At â‚¬40 per night this place cannot be faulted for single room accomodation - single bed,sink, clean towels and wardrobe. No TV or coffee making facilities provided. Do not let the shared toilet/shower facilities for single rooms put you off as this place is clean, centrally located and offers real value for money for the budget conscious traveller. Situated just 5 mins walk from Dam square and 12/15 mins walk (walking is no problem with a light holdall to avoid the â‚¬15 cab fare) from Amsterdam Central station. Cash on arrrival is required for payment and you need to vacate the room by 10am on day of departure. In summary, for a weekend away with your mates this hotel is ideal and offers reak value for money for a city where hotels can be pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: deneenc
Reviews.Content: This place is exactly what we were looking for. We had the room with the bay window and private bathroom. It wasn't luxurious, but was clean, the beds small but comfortable, but the price and the location was hard to beat. The only downside was not knowing we would need cash for the room. We found most of the ATM's in the area empty on a Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdams little jewel”
Reviews.Author: Britt0207
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at Hotel Aspen from 8/8 dep 11/8 in a twin sized room. The room was very large and the bathroom just as large (be careful about the step leading to the bathroom in Rm.2 as I tripped into the bathroom several times..haha). I loved our large bay window with window seat. It was a nice place to sit and relax after a long day. The owner was very friendly and always available to answer any questions. He was there to greet us every night as we climbed our way up the steep stairs. We read about the hotel on several websites and were well prepared for the steep staircase, which was a bit daunting at first. I will admit I was slightly nervous about how we were going to get our luggage back down the stairs upon departure, but we managed!! The location of the hotel was great, close proximity to the Anne Frank House, Dam Square and all the other sites of interest in Amsterdam. Plus, it is close to Central Station!! The downside to the hotel might have to be the small single beds. Mine was slightly lopsided and I felt like I would fall off of it on a few occasions. One recommendation might be to provide plastic cups that are wrapped in plastic instead of unwrapped plastic cups being left in the bathroom. With that said I would still happily stay at Hotel Aspen again and will recommend it to others (who are fit and healthy to cope with the stairs) as the price and location outweighed anything that might have been negative. There is a fairly large grocery store on the corner near the hotel so a great place to stock up on water and snacks, which will help to save money. However the cafe's are all really nice with reasonable prices. My new favorite store has also got to be Hema! Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “very close to everything, good room and showers!”
Reviews.Author: edkate
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Amsterdam for 1 day in the begging of June of this year: my mother over 50 years old (very physically active), my 20 year old sis and myself. I must stay itâ€™s about 10-15 min walk from Central station so there is no need to take a cab (just a waste of money). Print off the area map from Google and there you go. As other people said the stairs are very steep! Just be careful! Room was ok. We got the quadruple room as the hotel doesnâ€™t have triple rooms, I think, not sure. We had private shower. Water pressure was good; shower was sparkling clean as well as the room. We got the room on the third floor with windows facing the back of the house in the quite neighborhood. The mattress was very comfortable especially after a lot of walking. I would stay in this hotel again if we get a chance to go see Amsterdam. Btw, take a canal bus tour. Itâ€™s around 18 euros but itâ€™s much worth it cause you can hop on and off as you want.

Reviews.Title: “Spartan room but entirely reasonable experience”
Reviews.Author: dukektown
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Aspen for a quick visit to Amsterdam. Only needing a single room, I was more than happy to opt for a low cost option, and the Hotel Aspen was one of the few affordable choices in a good, central location. The Hotel Aspen is basically a converted house. The owners live in a tidy and compact room that doubles as the check-in area. The owner makes you feel quite welcome and makes the check-in process smooth. You are provided with two keys, one for the outside door and the other for your room. That is nice since you do not have to worry about reclaiming your key every time you walk back into the hotel. My room was very, very simple. The side table could best be described as a very short stool. There was a modern (Ikea-like) wardrobe. Otherwise, not much else. The bed was borderline comfortable. There was a shared bathroom for my room category which was rather rough. The shower was separate from the toilet and basically was a small closet with a sliding door. It was very, very difficult to get into the shower without having water go everywhere. So, I ended up walking around with a small towel around me to go use the shower. No big deal for me, but I cannot imagine my wife finding that particularly acceptable. Of course, one could always get a higher room category with an ensuite bathroom. The Hotel Aspen is well-located near Dam Square. It is maybe a five minute walk to Dam Square and all the fun nearby. The public transportation system runs right by the Hotel and can get you anywhere in Amsterdam fairly quickly. The noise from the streets was a little more than I would have liked, but it was not that bad. A full-service grocery store was nearby (just off of Dam Square) and very good. Overall, my stay at the Hotel Aspen was entirely as expected based on the reviews from Trip Advisor. I was not expecting much for 40 euros a night, and felt it was entirely worth the light cost.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, good location - functional”
Reviews.Author: Waddler
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Amsterdam are expensive - you have got to deal with it, with that in mind this place is very, very good value. We paid 80 Euros for a 4 bed en-suite. We were over for a sports tournament, and weren't going to be hanging around too much so it suited our needs well. I didn't find our room particularly cramped, though it isn't big, and the beds are fairly narrow (I fell out of it one night! But it isn't too high off the floor so it didn't matter!) and the room and en-suite shower/toilet are clean. The location is very central for everything with a tram stop very close that goes up to Central Station, Spui, Leidseplein (all within walkin distance anyway) and the Museumplein, and only a couple of minutes walk from Dam Square. It is also, though on a fairly busy road, very close to one of the prettier canal areas in Amsterdam - just walk up or down Prinsengracht, Keizergracht or Herengracht and the street between them and you'll find traditional homes, boutique shops, canal-side cafes and little bars and restaurants - you are also very close to the atmospheric local Jordaan area. That said, it isn't luxury, there is no breakfast, the stairs are very steep by international standards and there is no other way up (but by no means very steep by Amsterdam standards), there isn't anything in the way of facilities but none of this botheres me. The dude behind the desk was a little odd (he'd gone rifling though my bag because my phone was ringing whilst I was out - which I wasn't too keen on). Seemed quite an international bunch staying there - only 4 or 5 rooms I think.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price / Excellent proprietors”
Reviews.Author: SpaceDad
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Aspen in November of 2006 in order to attend a music function in Amsterdam that lasted through a weekend. I knew I wouldn't be spending too much time at my hotel room, so I wanted something utilitarian (but clean), close to the city center and, yes, not too expensive. The Hotel Aspen fit the bill perfectly and provided a bit more. It's within walking distance (approx. 1 mile) of the Central Rail Station and close to everything in the City Center. The proprietor (unfortunately I didn't write down his name) couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. When I checked in, he immediately provided me with a great walking map of Amsterdam and spent quite a while talking with me about what I wanted to do and the best ways to do it. Both he and his wife treated me extremely well and made me feel right at home. Everything was squeaky clean, including the shared bathroom. I am used to traveling in Europe, so I know that for the price range we are talking about here, you're going to get a tiny room, shared bath, etc. If you want an American-style hotel room, it's going to cost a LOT more than the Aspen, so don't expect luxury. For the single traveller, such as me, who needs a "home base" from which to enjoy the city, it's perfect. You will probably read a lot about the steep stairs here. It's true, the stairs are well, awesomely steep. However, that's they way it is in almost every building I saw in Amsterdam, and I learned to negotiate them after a short time. I was also travelling quite light - if you have a problem getting around, or are carrying lots of baggage, the stairs might very well be a problem. For the price (Amsterdam is an enormously expensive city, hotel-wise), I can't imagine getting a better deal than the Aspen provided - highly recommended for the practical traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: docdanz
Reviews.Content: This is a superbly located small backpacker type hotel just a couple of minutes walk from Dam square. It was very basic (with the double bed being closer to 3 quarter size and the room being smaller than anything else we stayed in in Europe) but clean and tidy, which was exactly what we wanted after getting of the plane after a 12 hour flight. The steep stairs were not a problem for us but I can see how they could be for someone older or with heavy suitcases (we had packs). The shared shower was clean and always free when we wanted it but was literally located in a cupboard in the hallway. The price seemed a little steep for such basic accommodation at 60 euros per night (plus 5% tax - a hidden cost), especially compared with lovely renovated hotels we stayed at in places like Paris and Bordeaux however I agree that it is excellent for Amsterdam - most places are in need of renovation and bedrooms are uniformly tiny. The owner was very helpful and gave good advice and service. Whilst something bigger, newer and cheaper would have been great, I would still stay here again as I know that Amsterdam is small, old and expensive, and the excellent location makes this hotel stand out amongst a mediocre bunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Clean Deal”
Reviews.Author: Triskel Bay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal for Amsterdam. The price is low yet the owner keeps the place incredibly clean. Not your usual euro filthy place. The location is great and close to everything you would want to walk to. The shower is ok, but if you have long hair to wash it is subpar. The rooms that have a peak view at the canal can be a bit noisy due to the main road. If you dont want the noise though you can request a room on the other side. The stairs in this place are very steep. You have to carry your luggage up the stairs as well. So I only recommend this place to those with little luggage or those that are in good shape. There are no frills like a tv or alarm clock or coffee pot in the room. It is literally a GREAT price for a VERY clean place to stay that is centrally located in a nice area. If you buy bottled water take the walk two blocks by the palace and there is a grocery store there. You will save 1 to 2 euro's buying your water there as opposed to the convenience stores. Highly recommend renting bikes and taking the ferry to the countrside and riding around. The Cafe's not Coffee shops serve excellent coffee and they are everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: amyhw
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Aspen after I read the reviews on trip advisor, it lived up to all the praise. In a fantastic location for the wjole of Amsterdam the hotel was clean and the manager very friendly. I would say the only real downside was the stairs which were amazingly steep but at least we've now got healthy leg muscles! overall a lovely little hotel, we would definitley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: EnjoytheJourney
Reviews.Content: Great location can walk to everything to see in Amsterdam. Unbeatable price. Very friendly staff. Very clean. Small rooms but what do you expect, you are in Europe! Rooms facing street can be noisy (bring ear plugs).

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There were 4 of us staying in the Quad Room (Room 2) and the beds were very comfortable and very clean. They are quite narrow beds so if you're a large size you may struggle. The shower was hot although not a lot of pressure but it got you clean - what more could you want! Got quite chilly in the room in the afternoon as there was no heating switched on but we didnt spend alot of time in there anyway. Great location quite close to everything although when we arrived we took a taxi from the station as it was raining and it only cost 9 euros for 4 of us. The owner was a lovely friendly and helpful man, always smiling. On the downside, it would have been nice if there had been coffee or tea making facilities especially if like me all you want in a morning is a cuppa, plenty of sockets though so take a kettle with you. And the stairs are killers!!! Thank goodness our room was on the second floor I dont think I could have made it any further - but its Amsterdam so what more can you expect. If you're on a budget I would definitely recommend Hotel Aspen.

Reviews.Title: “twin room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean, yes, but the twin beds were too small. Aprox 60 cm wide, even for a average peron. We had to move the beds and sleep comfortable on the matrass on the floor, because I found myself on the floor during the night when i tried the bed. Shower was not good, no pressure. We wanted to leave the first night after we saw the double room we've booked, reason: The room with the double bed was found too depressing by us, and the bedsize was suitable for one and a half person. We were told that the cancelation rate was one night anyway if you cancel within 48 hours. So we were forced to stay in the twin room with shower and toilet after our discussion that we couldn't spend the night in the tiny double bedroom. I must say that the website looked more appealing than in reality.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget accomodation”
Reviews.Author: DavidAilie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aspen for 3 nights in March 2006, We were in room No.6(rear-facing) No problem with noise. Basic accomodation with clean hand towels every day, room was clean however a bit cold(It was -2 outside)the radiators could do with bleeding to heat up more! Apart from this we enjoyed our stay. One other thing - The stairs are awsome - Not for the unfit!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the independent traveller”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Amsterdam on my own as a break from my friends in Germany in the autumn of 2005. I found the Hotel Aspen in the guide book I bought and had no idea what to expect when I reserved a single room with shared bath. As I made the quick 15 minute walk from Amsterdam's Central Station, I realized that Hotel Aspen was situated in one of the nicer neighborhoods of Amsterdam. The hotel's location seemed central to everything you'd want to do & see in Amsterdam. My room was clean and well-lit, and just the right size for a single traveller. The shared bathroom was cleaned continuously throughout the day. All the staff were very nice & helpful and the owner was an incredibly nice man who was always there with a smile and a friendly greeting. I highly recommend staying at this hotel if you want a great value in Amsterdam. When I return to Amsterdam in spring 2006, I will certainly stay at the Hotel Aspen.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: mgt715
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms and service for a budget hotel. The staff was very accomodating, helpful and friendly. We had a group of 7 people and stayed in 2 doubles and a triple at the beginning of September for 3 nights. We had our own bathroom in each of the rooms, and everything was very clean. Our rooms were very spacious. The walk was only about 15 minutes from the train station, with our backpacks. You can't get a better location than this. Dam Square (what I consider to be in the middle of everything) is just a couple of blocks away. The street car goes right past the front of the hotel (which can be a bit noisy if staying in the front side of the hotel with the windows open). There were quite a few stairs, but not so bad after you don't have your luggage with you. We had backpacks, so not a problem for us at all, just take them slow. Overall a great experience. Hotel Aspen is the place I will stay whenever I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “No nonsense hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel to experience a new place and not a hotel in a new place; so I prefer hotels that provide just the basis necessities at a good price and are clean and safe. Aspen met all my conditions. Plus it is at a great location: Rijksmuseum, Dam Square, Anne Frank House are all within 15 minutes of walking distance. If you know better than "bigger is better", you would love this place. And yes, you will remember the tall stairway too, but which place in Amsterdam doesn't have those? I will definitely go back to Aspen.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great value”
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Room #8, a very small single room, from 22-26 june 2005. Yes, this is a no frills hotel, centrally situated, cheap and clean (I got new towels every day!), but if your room faces the Raadhuisstraat, as did mine, it is definitely not quiet during warm summer nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value- Good Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSpartans
Reviews.Content: Good location within short walking distance of Dam Square, Centraal Station and Anne Frank House. The room was simple (no tv or phone) but very clean and quiet (we had rear facing room). We were there for three nights in late April 2005 during the Queen's Day Celebration and had no trouble with noise. The room had four single beds (for two adults and two kids) and attached private shower/bathroom. Very friendly staff (Esam) helped to make our first visit to Amsterdam a true pleasure. Would highly recommend for those looking for a clean, cost effective lodging alternative with no frills (be aware that the stairs to the rooms are steep- hard to manuever with large/heavy luggage).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great price”
Reviews.Author: unhitchedtrailers
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single at the Hotel Aspen for 5 nights in early April. It fulfilled all of my requirements for a hotel: clean, comfortable bed, convenient location, and good price. At the Aspen, you get the added bonus of Esam, the proprietor, who is always willing to offer restaurant and transportation suggestions as well as the weather forecast, maps, and umbrellas. Quite the character! The hotel is walking distance to Centraal Station and all of the major sights. My room was tiny but spotless, and the shared bathroom and shower were literally right outside my door (and never once occupied when I needed it). I was also rather giddy to discover that I had my very own gargoyle just outside the window. The only downside has been mentioned by others before me: THE STAIRS--I'll be seeing those stairs in my nightmares for years to come. But, hey, it's good exercise and it's the perfect justification to have another pannenkoeken with cream!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel once you climb all the stairs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After walking a mile through the snow to get to this hotel, we open the door to see tiny stairs as far as the eye can see! We drag out luggage up to the clerk, who informs us that our room is yet another two flights up! This hotel is definitely not for those of us who pack heavy, but it was a huge room, very clean, and in a good location. I'd stay again, but only if I packed much much lighter!

Reviews.Title: “So friendly, but whoa the stairs!”
Reviews.Author: invisigirl23
Reviews.Content: Fantastic for the price! When we checked in everything was good, we got a map showing different areas such as nightclubs, markets, red light etc. Room was tiny, but had a lovely outlook - anyway in Amsterdam there is something wrong if you are spending much time in your room! Not once in our 3 day stay was the shared toilet or shower (tiny cubicle room, nowhere to put clothes) occupied. By the 3rd night we weren't even bothering to get dressed to go to the loo! Overall, great value for 42 euro a night, handy to everything, and a great walk to red light/centraal (up a big shopping street - yeah!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Mama2Jack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Aspen in March of 2004 and could not have been more pleased. The double room we stayed in faced the back of the building and looked out over a courtyard. The room was clean as was the bathroom on our floor. I did not regret booking a room with shared bath as I never once had to wait to use the facilities. The owners are extremely helpful and friendly, giving us a map with directions to the major attractions upon arrival. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and would not hesitate to stay here again. A great value!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Aspen
HotelInfo.Address: Raadhuisstraat 31, Amsterdam 1016, The Netherlands
